--- title: "Chaoyue R. Wang" about: id: about-heading template: trestles image: profile.jpg image-width: 15em links: - icon: twitter text: Twitter href: https://twitter.com/raphael_cwang - icon: github text: GitHub href: https://github.com/dsanchezp18 - icon: bar-chart-fill text: RPubs href: https://rpubs.com/dsanchezp998 - icon: file-person-fill text: CV href: files/cv/daniel_sanchez_cv.pdf --- ::: {#about-heading} ## Bio I grew up in an industrial neighborhood in Chongqing, China, and then went to Beijing for my undergraduate education. I am currently a senior student of Philosophy, Politics and Economics at Peking University. With a regional focus on American politics, my current interest lays at the intersection between partisan attachments and a broader range of social identities, principally race and ethnicity. Specifically, I am concerned about: first, how social processes and cognitive mechanisms, combined with historical contexts, can furnish identities that are by content apolitical with political meanings; second, how individuals perceive and react to their everyday life, be it political or not, through a lens of racial identities and racial relations. :::
As put by [Professor Daniel M. Gim√©nez](https://twitter.com/Ego_Ipse), R is my copilot - I became passionate about data analysis and visualization using R during my undergraduate studies in econometrics, and I've been using R as much as I can ever since.
## Education ``{=html} - BA in Philosophy, Politics and Economics (PPE) \| expected 2023 \| **Peking University** ## Research Interets ``{=html} ::: columns ::: column - American Politics - Race and Ethnic Politics (REP) - Political Behavior - Public Opinion ::: ::: column - Politics of Identity - Racial Imagery - Social Cleavage - Partisanship - Affective Polarization ::: :::
